meanings.definition: Make (an object or system) more efficient or straightforward by removing unnecessary elements or simplifying processes.
meanings.sent1: She streamlines her morning routine by preparing everything the night before.
meanings.sent2: The company streamlines its production process to save time and resources.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he needed to streamline his closet by getting rid of all the clothes he never wears.
meanings.sent4: The new software streamlines the data entry process, making it faster and easier.
meanings.sent5: Streamlining the paperwork will help us finish the project ahead of schedule.

meanings.definition: A contour that represents a line of constant flow velocity in a fluid.
meanings.sent1: The engineer studied the streamlines in the wind tunnel to analyze airflow patterns.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted beautiful streamlines to depict the fluid motion of the river.
meanings.sent3: The streamlines in the experiment looked like colorful ribbons dancing in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The streamlines of the river seemed to guide the boats effortlessly downstream.
meanings.sent5: The streamlines in the water showed the smooth path of the current.
